{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3567579,"name":"Jacobo","username":"JacoboNassar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/958977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T00:30:02.692Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Im trying to figure out what the recommendations are to make megatags 1 and 2 give accurate readings. From what distance on should tags be ignored? i’d appreciate any other advice related to the topic. Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T00:30:02.692Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":106.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496817,"topic_slug":"what-filters-should-i-apply-to-get-an-accurate-reading-from-megatag-1-and-2","display_username":"Jacobo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74615,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-filters-should-i-apply-to-get-an-accurate-reading-from-megatag-1-and-2/496817/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3567678,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T01:37:38.091Z","cooked":"

I suggest you experiment with your robot/LL setup and here’s some things to look for.

Calibrate your LL - it’s easier not on the robot.

Try to get an accurate pose of the LL on your robot. If you have compound angles on the mount it’s a bit hard and the CAD drawing may be your best bet.

Make sure your AprilTags that you test are flat to the mounting surface. A scrap piece of clear plastic can help a lot if need be.

Make sure your gyro is reset to angles that you want to test (gyros drift so make it a fresh reset).

Expect the MegaTag to start being too jittery to use further than about 1.1 meters from the tag.

MegaTag2 may stop calculating too close to the tag even before the tag isn’t fully visible. MegaTag can get a bit closer up to the point the tag isn’t fully visible.

MegaTag2 may not be accurate further than 2 or 3 meters.

You might use MegaTag up close and MegaTag2 at a distance but my team decided that MegaTag2 was adequate for our closeups, too.

LL suggests cutting off at gyro rate of 720 degrees/second but much less may be much more reasonable cutoff.

Select the Tag that is important for your pose, for example, reef tags, to keep out distant tags that can detract from the pose.

If you don’t think the Tag pose is highly accurate but is somewhat accurate then do the addVisionMeasurement to the pose estimator with the wheel and gyro odometry.

If you think the Tag pose is highly accurate then reset your odometry to the Tag pose.
If you are using more than one LL then expect them not to be identical - check both.

Don’t be surprised if you need a bit of a fudge factor to hit the reef perfectly based on the LL-wheel-gyro odometry. Part of the fudge factor may be for a PathPlanner inaccuracy so try to get paths the best you can before fudging the complete system.

Again, do your own experimentation under your conditions that you want to use the AprilTags. It’s easier if you know when you want to use the tags and what conditions you don’t need them. My team is happy using them only on the reef and up close.

SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

Calibrate your LL - it’s easier not on the robot.

hello, our team is using ll3.Is there an efficient way to calibrate limelight3? Because we have not found any method to calibrate ll3 in the official website, our ll3 lens is very fuzzy, may I ask whether the focal length is a problem? Will it affect its 3dtracking ability? Thank you for your help!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T11:05:11.491Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":22.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496817,"topic_slug":"what-filters-should-i-apply-to-get-an-accurate-reading-from-megatag-1-and-2","display_username":"wbzjt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68490,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-filters-should-i-apply-to-get-an-accurate-reading-from-megatag-1-and-2/496817/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568871,"name":"","username":"Akshaj_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T11:19:26.205Z","cooked":"

The limelight docs can be hard, but try to follow these steps to calibrate the LL: ChArUco Camera Calibration | Limelight Documentation

You could also always just use the default calibration if you’d like. The fuzziness could be a problem. I’m not sure whether a LL3 has this, but a LL3G has a pipeline called focus. The LL3G lens however isn’t attached and can rotate, so this pipeline helps figure out how to get maximum focus. You wont have this problem since you are using a LL3, but I’m not sure if you’d be able to access the focus pipeline type. We had our focus number be around 1300-1500 (higher the better), but it might be different for you guys since it’s a LL3. The docs don’t provide info about how it calculates the focus score.

Akshaj_K:

calibrate

Thank you for your answer. I will go back and try calibrate our ll3, and I will check the focus questions again. Thanks again!

Clean your LL lens first then focus it. I found using the LL focus pipeline exceedingly difficult as the numeric measure is highly sensitive to movement - changing scene that the camera sees - and holding the camera still with my fat fingers trying to turn the lens while staying out of the view was hard. You can eye-ball the focus almost as well by pointing at some text a few feet away. After focusing make sure you glue it in or at least clearly mark it so you can reset if necessary.
